intro: Anil flavicans, commonly known as the yellow-flowered anil, is a tropical plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its striking yellow flowers and lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments such as forest undergrowth. Its botanical classification places it in the family Rubiaceae, which includes many other flowering plants. Anil flavicans is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant floral display.
